settings.hero_heading:
From cemeteries to reserves:

the TYC Landscaping commitment to Napier’s green spaces

settings.grid-item_paragraph: Wool matting was used for its moisture retention, weed suppression, and biodegradability.
Native plants such as haemophilus and jacaranda trees, grass seed for lawns.

settings.heading-text-columns-separate_heading: Superior moisture retention, stability, local availability, and eco-friendliness compared to coir.
settings.heading-text-columns-separate_text_1:
Wool.Life products have greatly improved moisture
retention and weed suppression in TYC Landscaping
projects. The wool matting’s longevity and integrity make it ideal for both native plantings and ornamental gardens.

Erosion control is significantly better with wool matting compared to traditional methods.
settings.heading-text-columns-separate_text_2: TYC Landscaping plans to continue using Wool.Life products in future projects due to their proven effectiveness and the excellent support from Gareth and the Wool.Life team.

custom_css: h5 {color: #44693d; font-family: Sora; font-size: 12px; font-style: normal; font-weight: 700; line-height: 100%; /* 12px */ letter-spacing: 0.24px; text-transform: uppercase; margin-top: 32px;}

settings.text-column_text:
“The core benefits of wool matting include its ability to mulch down, prevent weeds, and hold moisture. It’s a really good barrier that doesn’t prevent water from seeping through.”
Danielle, TYC Landscaping

settings.image-with-content_heading: Local availability, reasonable pricing, and excellent customer service.
settings.image-with-content_text:
TYC Landscaping chose Wool.Life due to its local availability, reasonable pricing, and excellent customer service. 

Gareth from Wool.Life is highly responsive and makes the quoting process straightforward by calculating the square meterage and providing precise pricing, making it all very easy.
